document.discussion_title: Synchrony Financial’s (SYF) Buy Rating Reiterated at DA Davidson
document.topic_text: Tweet Synchrony Financial (NYSE:SYF) ‘s stock had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by research analysts at DA Davidson in a note issued to investors on Monday, MarketBeat reports. A number of other analysts have also recently weighed in on SYF. Deutsche Bank reissued a “buy” rating on shares of Synchrony Financial in a research report on Saturday, April 9th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. reaffirmed a “buy” rating on shares of Synchrony Financial in a research report on Saturday. Vetr cut Synchrony Financial from a “strong-buy” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $33.36 price target for the company. in a research report on Tuesday, April 19th. BTIG Research reaffirmed a “buy” rating and set a $42.00 price target on shares of Synchrony Financial in a research report on Friday, January 22nd. Finally, Zacks Investment Research raised Synchrony Financial from a “sell” rating to a “hold” rating in a research report on Thursday. Three analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, eighteen have assigned a buy rating and one has given a strong buy rating to the company’s stock. The stock has a consensus rating of “Buy” and an average target price of $37.82. A number of large investors have recently bought and sold shares of SYF. Osborn Rohs Williams & Donohoe purchased a new stake in Synchrony Financial during the fourth quarter valued at approximately $380,000. Beacon Capital Management purchased a new stake in Synchrony Financial during the fourth quarter valued at approximately $0. Verde Servico Internacionais purchased a new stake in Synchrony Financial during the fourth quarter valued at approximately $46,896,000. ExxonMobil Investment Management purchased a new stake in Synchrony Financial during the fourth quarter valued at approximately $5,683,000. Finally, Nisa Investment Advisors raised its stake in Synchrony Financial by 318.6% in the fourth quarter. Nisa Investment Advisors now owns 75,353 shares of the company’s stock valued at $2,291,000 after buying an additional 57,353 shares during the period. Shares of Synchrony Financial ( NYSE:SYF ) traded down 0.803% during midday trading on Monday, hitting $30.255. 3,649,654 shares of the stock were exchanged. The firm has a market capitalization of $25.23 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 11.417. The stock’s 50-day moving average price is $28.65 and its 200-day moving average price is $29.48. Synchrony Financial has a 1-year low of $23.74 and a 1-year high of $36.40. Synchrony Financial (NYSE:SYF) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Friday, April 22nd. The company reported $0.70 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the Zacks’ consensus estimate of $0.69 by $0.01. The business earned $3.21 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $3.17 billion. During the same period in the previous year, the business earned $0.66 EPS. On average, analysts forecast that Synchrony Financial will post $2.81 EPS for the current year. Synchrony Financial ( NYSE:SYF ) is a consumer financial services company. The Company provides a range of credit products through programs it has established with a group of retailers, local merchants, manufacturers, buying groups, industry associations and healthcare service providers. //www.americanbankingnews.com/2016/04/25/synchrony-financials-syf-buy-rating-reiterated-at-da-davidson/ Synchrony Financial Synchrony Financial
